title: Reksai Question
body: Why don't Noxus use Rek'Sai as a battering ram, like a siege weapon, to attack their enemies cities? I read that the Noxians were already using Rek'Sai in the arena's across Noxus as a attraction? So why not use Rek as a Noxian weapon against their enemies?

replies.body:
I know the Rek'Sai teaser you're talking about (with the [Noxian explorer's journal](https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/creative-spotlight/reksai-scourge-desert)) but if you remember, he did _not_ successfully capture a Xer'Sai to send back to Noxus.  Instead, even small ones were able to kill accomplished trackers and beasts.

As for Rek'Sai herself?  Oh dear me no - if the Noxians can't even capture one of her children (small and weak and stupid in comparison) they have NO HOPE WHATSOEVER of capturing Rek'Sai.  The idea of being able to then use her as some kind of weapon... wow.  That's an ambitious thought.

Maybe I should turn it around - what do _you_ think it would take to be able to face Rek'Sai her preferred territory, the Shuriman Desert (The Sai'Khaleek)?  How many soldiers do you think you'd need, or something like it.  I'm not asking about in-game.  Rek'Sai can burrow through sand and solid rock, travels [faster than most land-animals](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZZNuTgQ8WFA), and is many times bigger than a camel.

(Felt I could also link her color story:[ Sai Kahleek](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/reksai-color-story/), which follows someone who ventures into the desert.)

Maybe even use some kind of "sonic weapon" created with hextech devices to confuse the blind creatures using sound waves (of course that something like that has not been mentioned in the lore... but maybe Zaun has the technology to do such thing).

Sure, Singed is Zaunite but he helped Noxus during the invasion of Ionia, so, it counts.

Zaun for the Win.
